info.title: AWorld API - App Endpoints
info.description: The App context provides APIs for integrating with and extending applications built on the AWorld platform. These APIs are designed for use in end-user applications and client-side interfaces.

post.description:
Creates a new activity log entry for a user. 
    This endpoint is intended for backend systems to record custom user activities defined through the Dashboard. 
    Built-in activities such as quizzes, stories, and other internal events are automatically tracked and should not be manually created through this endpoint.

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description: Optional (but recommended) idempotency key to prevent duplicate processing of the same request. Any string can be used (e.g., a UUID or a nanoid).

schema.description: Optional (but recommended) idempotency key to prevent duplicate processing of the same request. Any string can be used (e.g., a UUID or a nanoid).

activityId.description: The unique ID of the activity. Should be a nanoid

get.description:
Retrieves a list of available missions for the authenticated user. 
    Missions are tasks or challenges that users can complete to earn rewards.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of the page

schema.description: Size of the page

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

schema.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

missionType.description: Type of mission (individual or group-based). When set to GROUP, progress is tracked collectively for all users associated with the same tag, according to the mission rules or manual assignment.

missionConfigurationId.description: Unique identifier for the mission configuration (NanoID).

matchType.description: Determines how the mission's conditions are matched. When set to INSTANCE, a specific entity ID must be provided in matchEntityId. When set to ENTITY, all instances of the specified entity type are considered. When set to TAG, all entities associated with the specified tag ID are considered.

matchEntity.description: The entity type the mission's conditions apply to. When matchType is set to TAG, matchEntity must be set to Tag.

createdAt.description: Creation date in ISO format (UTC Timezone)

updatedAt.description: Creation date in ISO format (UTC Timezone)

nextToken.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

get.description:
Retrieves a list of available quizzes for the authenticated user. 
    Quizzes are educational content that users can complete to test their knowledge.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of the page

schema.description: Size of the page

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

schema.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

get.description:
Retrieves a specific quiz by its ID. 
    Includes quiz questions, options, and associated metadata.

post.description:
Submits answers for a specific quiz. 
    This endpoint processes the user's responses and returns the results.

get.description:
Retrieves a list of tags assigned to a specific quiz. 
    TagAssignments are used to categorize and organize quizzes.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of the page

schema.description: Size of the page

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

schema.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

get.description: Retrieves a specific tag assignment for a quiz by tag ID.
Retrieves the translation for a specific quiz in the user's preferred language.

Retrieves a list of available stories for the authenticated user. 
    Stories are educational content that users can read and engage with.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of the page

schema.description: Size of the page

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

schema.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

get.description:
Retrieves a specific story by its ID. 
    Includes story content, metadata, and associated information.

post.description:
Marks a story as completed by the user. 
    This endpoint tracks user engagement with story content.

get.description:
Retrieves a list of tags assigned to a specific story. 
    TagAssignments are used to categorize and organize stories.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of the page

schema.description: Size of the page

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

schema.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

get.description: Retrieves a specific tag assignment for a story by tag ID.
Retrieves the translation for a specific story in the user's preferred language.

Retrieves a list of streaks for the authenticated user. 
    Streaks track consecutive user activities and achievements over time.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of the page

schema.description: Size of the page

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

schema.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

get.description:
Retrieves information about the currently authenticated user. 
    Includes user profile data, settings, and associated metadata.

Retrieves the principal information for the currently authenticated user. 
    Principal contains the user's identity details.

Retrieves a list of tags assigned to the current user. 
    TagAssignments are used to categorize users and provide personalized experiences.

parameters.description: Size of the page

schema.description: Size of the page

parameters.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

get.summary: Get current user tag by ID
get.description: Retrieves a specific tag assigned to the current user by tag ID.

Retrieves a list of virtual currency balances for the authenticated user. 
    Virtual balances track the amount of each virtual currency the user owns.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of the page

schema.description: Size of the page

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

schema.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

get.summary: Get virtual balance by currency ID
get.description:
Retrieves the virtual balance for a specific virtual currency. 
    Shows the current amount of the specified virtual currency owned by the user.

404.description: Virtual currency or balance not found

get.description:
Retrieves a list of virtual currency transactions for the authenticated user. 
    Virtual transactions track credits, debits, and other changes to virtual currency balances.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of the page

schema.description: Size of the page

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

schema.description: Pagination cursor for fetching the next set of results

post.description:
Creates a new virtual currency transaction. 
    This endpoint allows users to initiate transactions such as purchases or transfers using virtual currency.

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description: Optional (but recommended) idempotency key to prevent duplicate processing of the same request. Any string can be used (e.g., a UUID or a nanoid).

schema.description: Optional (but recommended) idempotency key to prevent duplicate processing of the same request. Any string can be used (e.g., a UUID or a nanoid).

get.description:
Retrieves a specific virtual transaction by its ID. 
    Shows detailed information about the transaction including amount, currency, and status.

post.description:
Redeems a virtual transaction, typically converting virtual currency to real-world benefits or rewards. 
    This endpoint finalizes the redemption process for eligible transactions.

400.description: Invalid transaction or cannot be redeemed

JsonLogicExpression.description:
A JSON Logic expression used to define conditional rules in a declarative way.

JSON Logic is a lightweight way to express rules, conditions, and decision trees in JSON format.
This schema only validates that the input is valid JSON; it does not validate the correctness of
the JSON Logic operators or semantics.
notes: This schema ensures only that the value is valid JSON.
JSON Logic supports a wide variety of operators such as `==`, `and`, `or`, `>`, `<`, etc.
Consumers should validate semantics at runtime.
